description: Legal assistance and VA claims support for veterans

resources.title: VA Accredited Attorneys and Claims Agents
resources.description: The VA maintains a database of accredited attorneys, claims agents, and representatives authorized to assist veterans with VA benefits claims and appeals. Accredited representatives must meet VA standards and can charge fees only after a successful claim.
resources.summary: Official directory of VA-accredited representatives for benefits claims.
resources.eligibility: Veterans seeking representation for VA benefits claims or appeals.
resources.how_to_apply: Search the VA's accredited representative database online or contact your local VA Regional Office.
resources.cost: Fees vary; many VSOs offer free representation

resources.title: National Veterans Legal Services Program (NVLSP)
resources.description: NVLSP provides free legal services to veterans and their families on VA benefits issues. They represent veterans in disability claims, appeals, and systemic litigation that benefits all veterans.
resources.summary: Free legal representation for veterans on VA disability claims and appeals.
resources.eligibility: Veterans and their families with VA benefits claims, particularly complex cases.
resources.how_to_apply: Contact NVLSP through their website or call for assistance with your claim.

resources.title: VA Board of Veterans' Appeals
resources.description: The Board of Veterans' Appeals (BVA) reviews benefit claim appeals. Veterans can track their appeal status, understand the appeals process, and access resources for filing or responding to appeals.
resources.summary: Information and status tracking for VA benefits appeals.
resources.eligibility: Veterans with denied VA benefits claims seeking to appeal.
resources.how_to_apply: File a Notice of Disagreement (NOD) or Decision Review Request through VA.gov.

resources.title: Veterans Consortium Pro Bono Program
resources.description: The Veterans Consortium provides free legal representation to veterans appealing claims to the U.S. Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims. Volunteer attorneys are trained and matched with veterans needing representation.
resources.summary: Free legal representation for appeals to the Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims.
resources.eligibility: Veterans with appeals pending at the U.S. Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims.
resources.how_to_apply: Contact the Veterans Consortium when you receive a decision from the Board of Veterans' Appeals that you wish to appeal.

resources.title: Stateside Legal
resources.description: Stateside Legal is a comprehensive legal information resource for military members, veterans, and their families. It provides state-by-state guides to legal issues and connects users with free legal aid in their area.
resources.summary: Legal information and free legal aid finder for veterans and military families.
resources.eligibility: Military members, veterans, and their families seeking legal information or assistance.
resources.how_to_apply: Use the online resources or legal aid locator to find assistance in your state.

resources.title: Legal Services Corporation - Veterans Resources
resources.description: Legal Services Corporation (LSC) funds civil legal aid programs nationwide. Many LSC-funded programs have dedicated veterans units providing free legal help on civil matters like housing, family law, consumer issues, and benefits.
resources.summary: Network of legal aid organizations providing free civil legal services to veterans.
resources.eligibility: Low-income veterans needing civil legal assistance.
resources.how_to_apply: Use the legal aid locator to find your local LSC-funded program.
